episodes.title: Moment African 'tribe’ ARRESTED as police & immigration officers swoop on Kubala campsite
episodes.description:
THIS is the moment the ‘king’ and handmaiden of the so-called Kingdom of Kubala tribe were detained in an early morning raid.
Kofi Offeh and Kaura Taylor were nabbed by authorities in their camp in the woods of Jedbrah, Roxbrahshire, just after 8am on Thursday.
The duo were escorted out of the woods after an operation that involved cops, sheriff officers and eight members of the immigration team.
The Scottish Sun can confirm that Offeh has been arrested on suspicion of overstaying, while it remains unclear the reason for Taylor’s arrest.

episodes.title: Shock moment 'African tribe handmaiden'  floors angry local with brutal punch
episodes.description:
THIS is the moment that the second ‘rammy’ erupted between an ‘African tribe’ and angry locals in a Scottish forest in recent days.
Members of the so-called Kingdom of Kubala have been living in the woods in Jedburgh, Roxburghshire, since May.
Earlier today, cops swooped after a ‘fight’ broke out between locals and the ‘tribe’s’ handmaiden.
Footage showed the moment a clash erupted between the tribe and nearby residents, with many people broadcasting the brawl live on social media.

READ MORE: https://www.thescottishsun.co.uk/news/15406863/fight-breaks-out-kingdom-kubala-camp/

episodes.title: African tribe's 'Kubala King & Queen' pose 'RISK TO CHILDREN', warns official docs
episodes.description:
THE self-proclaimed King and Queen who are camped illegally in woods pose a “serious risk” to kids, documents reveal.

Official paperwork also shows Kofi Offeh, 36, and Jean Gasho, 43, were in a bust-up involving “knives” in their then home town in England.

The documents, seen by The Scottish Sun, were used in a court hearing earlier this year.

Since May the couple, who claim to lead the ‘Kingdom of Kubala’, have been living in tents near Jedburgh, Roxburghshire, with their American “handmaiden” Kaura Taylor, 21.

READ MORE: https://www.thescottishsun.co.uk/news/15400314/king-queen-kubala-tribe-scots-woods-serious-risk-children/

episodes.title: Jeburgh 'kingdom of Kubala' tribe immediate ARREST warning
episodes.description:
AN AFRICAN ‘tribe’ camping in woods faces immediate arrest if they breach a court order banning them from council land, we can reveal.

It is understood that Scottish Borders Council secured the special order against the so-called Kingdom of Kubala last week.

episodes.title: Moment African tribe confronted by angry locals as fiery row erupts in Scots forest
episodes.description:
This is the moment an 'African Tribe' was confronted by angry locals as they continue to occupy an area of forest in the Scottish Borders.

The self-styled Kubala tribe, living in the Scottish woodlands have been served a second eviction notice after moving campsites.

They claim they are taking back land stolen from their ancestors 400 years ago, have been living in the woods outside Jedburgh, Roxburghshire, since May this year.

READ MORE: https://www.thescottishsun.co.uk/news/15357860/kubala-tribe-second-eviction-jedburgh/

episodes.title: Fears tribe handmaiden is being 'groomed' by Kubala king and Queen
episodes.description:
THE Kingdom of Kubala tribe handmaiden yesterday insisted she’s not being held hostage – as a fresh move to evict the group was launched.

Kaura Taylor has been camping with the self-styled king and his wife in Jedburgh, Roxburghshire, since May.

episodes.title: Stunning truth behind African tribe's ‘Kubala king’ revealed
episodes.description:
THE self-styled ‘King of Kubala’ who faces eviction from a camp in Scots woods is a failed businessman, we can reveal.

Kofi Agyemang Offeh, 36, was director of entertainment, retail, property and performing arts firms which were struck off before he reinvented himself as leader of an ‘African tribe’.

episodes.title: African tribe REFUSING to leave Scots woods claim they will live in Jedburgh Castle
episodes.description:
AN AFRICAN tribe living in a Scots wood are facing court action after refusing to leave the land they have set up camp on.

The so-called Kingdom of Kubala moved into the remote site near Jedburgh in the Scottish Borders last month.
